intro: Sersalisia dugulla, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Sersalisia dugulla plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
